data.title: Command palette: Remember the last command
data.body:
I find myself very often writing the same command time after time persistently, so I think it would be cool if the command palette remember the last thing you wrote and so you only need to hit enter _instead of writing all again._

That would be very helpful.

data.title: Search: using "files to include" does not speed up search

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: Ubuntu 14.04

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open large directory with many files
2. Open search and enter term 
3. Use "files to include" to filter results to one directory with no subdirectories
4. Start search

Search takes a LONG time. It would be nice if filtering the results using "files to include" would speed up the search.

data.title: Debug Pause not working on VSCode 1.8.1
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Ubuntu 14.04, Windows 10 Anniversary

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Attach or launch using Microsoft C++ extension
2.  Try and break all (pause).

Expected - Break into application
Actual - Break command isn't sent to debugger.

data.title: Close parenthesis not inserted when open parenthesis entered directly to the left of a semicolon

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 Enterprise

Steps to Reproduce:

0. This is using JavaScript.
1. Type a semicolon.
2. Place the cursor directly to the left of the semicolon.
3. Enter an open parenthesis.

Context does not appear to matter with this.  You can reproduce this on a blank line.  Entering an open parenthesis inserts a close parenthesis as we might expect.  However if there is a semicolon to the right of the cursor, entering an open parenthesis does not result in a matching close parenthesis.  Invocation of a function does not appear to matter.

data.body:

Dependencies:
"devDependencies": {
    "enzyme": "^2.4.1",
    "eslint": "^3.11.1",
    "eslint-config-airbnb": "^13.0.0",
    "eslint-import-resolver-babel-module": "^2.2.1",
    "eslint-plugin-flowtype": "2.21.0",

    "jsdom": "^9.5.0",
    "moxios": "^0.3.0",

    "stylelint": "^7.6.0",
    "supertest": "^2.0.0",
    "supertest-as-promised": "^4.0.0",
    "webpack-dev-server": "^1.15.1"
  },
  "dependencies": {
    "axios": "^0.14.0",
    "babel-core": "^6.14.0",
    "babel-eslint": "7.0.0",
    "babel-loader": "^6.2.5",
    "babel-plugin-module-resolver": "^2.4.0",
    "babel-plugin-transform-regenerator": "^6.16.1",
    "babel-plugin-transform-runtime": "^6.15.0",
    "babel-polyfill": "^6.16.0",
    "babel-preset-es2015": "^6.14.0",
    "babel-preset-react": "^6.11.1",
    "babel-preset-stage-0": "^6.5.0",
    "bunyan": "^1.8.3",
    "cookie-parser": "^1.4.3",
    "cookies-js": "^1.2.3",
    "css-loader": "^0.25.0",
    "express": "^4.14.0",
    "extract-text-webpack-plugin": "^1.0.1",
    "file-loader": "^0.9.0",
    "mixpanel": "^0.5.0",
    "nconf": "^0.8.4",
    "node-sass": "^3.13.0",
    "pm2": "^2.0.18",
    "postal": "^2.0.4",
    "postcss-loader": "^1.1.1",
    "react": "^15.3.1",
    "react-dom": "^15.3.1",
    "react-redux": "^4.4.5",
    "react-router": "^2.8.1",
    "react-router-redux": "^4.0.5",
    "redux": "^3.6.0",

    "yargs": "^6.0.0"
  },

I open a js/jsx file in my project that has import statements, for example "import React from 'react';", but do not receive intellisense support for React.  When checking ~/Library/Application Support/Microsoft I only have a Silverlight folder.  I have verified that "typescript.disableAutomaticTypeAcquisition": false is set.

Any other help on how I can track down the issue would be appreciated!  If I'm missing any helpful information please let me know and I'll provide asap.

data.title: Contribute command without it showing up in the command palette
data.body: I want to contribute a command for a context menu item, which doesn't make sense in the command palette. The command is for the debug call stack, to add a frame to the skipFiles list. Any way to do this? Otherwise it will just be a noop in the command palette.

data.title: Fix markdown syntax highlighting for script or style html elements with blank lines
data.body:
Fixes #18069

**Bug**
Script and style blocks inside markdown cannot contain blank lines

**fix**
Add a specific rule for script, style, and pre blocks according to the common mark spec: http://spec.commonmark.org/0.27/#html-block

data.title: Share the .vscode directory on a USB or Drive.
data.body:
Good day all

Is there a way to make VSCode work from a different .vscode directory than the default one. I know that there are extensions that can do this, but I was just wondering if there is a way to change the path to .vscode directory.

data.title: Format on unsaved JS/TS not working
data.body:

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a new file by [Ctrl+n] or [Cmd+n] (so the file is named "Untitled-1"
2. Change the Langauge Mode to JavaScript (in lower right task bar)
3. Paste some unformatted JS/TS code
4. Try to format code [Alt+Shift+f]

Expect the code to be formatted, but it does not.

The same steps work for XML/HTML.

data.title: Regex replace with single space replaces with no space
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.8.1 (ee428b0eead68bf0fb99ab5fdc4439be227b6281, 2016-12-19T14:49:23.350Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.9.2|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. In an MD file, add this text: HRESULT OnAmbientPropertyChange(DISPID   dispid);

2. fire up replace dialog and insert this regex: \b\s{3}\b and in the replace box put a single literal space
3. expected:  "DISPID dispid" actual: "DISPIDdispid"

data.title: Build output is showing duplicate lines
data.body:
- VSCode Version:
Version 1.9.0-insider (1.9.0-insider)
c6a320c4f9c53b809a9615324a5b563eeb217984
2017-01-04T09:08:01.526Z

- OS Version:
macOS 10.12.2


Symptoms:
I just did my daily Insiders upgrade and suddenly my build output is showing duplicate lines. I have restarted VSCode and tried the build command several times; it is generating the same spurious lines each time. This has never happened until this morning; I use Insiders every day, so it may be a recent regression.

Here is my tasks.json:
```
{
  "version": "0.1.0",
  "command": "make",
  "isShellCommand": true,
  "args": [],
  "showOutput": "always"
}
```

Here is the correct output of `make` in Terminal:
```
swift build --build-path _build
Compile Swift Module 'ploy' (71 sources)
/Users/gwk/work/ploy/src/TypeCtx.swift:282:11: error: use of unresolved identifier 'actExpr'
          actExpr.form.failType("\(c.desc) \(msg). \(c.actDesc)actual type: \(act); \(c.expDesc)expected type: \(exp).")
          ^~~~~~~
/Users/gwk/work/ploy/src/TypeCtx.swift:44:17: note: did you mean 'trackExpr'?
  mutating func trackExpr(_ expr: Expr, type: Type) {
                ^
<unknown>:0: error: build had 1 command failures
error: exit(1): /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/swift-build-tool -f /Users/gwk/work/ploy/_build/debug.yaml
make: *** [build] Error 1
```

And here is the output in the VSCode output pane. Note the duplicate lines at top. Multiple tries resulted in the same output.
```
swift build --build-path _build
swift build --build-path _build
Compile Swift Module 'ploy' (71 sources)
swift build --build-path _build
Compile Swift Module 'ploy' (71 sources)
/Users/gwk/work/ploy/src/TypeCtx.swift:282:11: error: use of unresolved identifier 'actExpr'
          actExpr.form.failType("\(c.desc) \(msg). \(c.actDesc)actual type: \(act); \(c.expDesc)expected type: \(exp).")
          ^~~~~~~
/Users/gwk/work/ploy/src/TypeCtx.swift:44:17: note: did you mean 'trackExpr'?
  mutating func trackExpr(_ expr: Expr, type: Type) {
                ^
<unknown>:0: error: build had 1 command failures
swift-build: error: exit(1): /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/swift-build-tool -f /Users/gwk/work/ploy/_build/debug.yaml
make: *** [build] Error 1
```

data.title: Add expand all / collapse all support for file explorer folders.
data.body: In sublime, if you alt-click a folder that is closed, it will open all subfolders as well, (expanding the entire tree). If you alt-click a folder that is opened, it will collapse the entire tree underneath, and upon reopening you will have a nice fresh view of closed folders, etc. Would love to have this functionality in vs code!

data.title: Regex find/replace: Cannot prefix newline
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Windows 7

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open any file that is not empty and has multiple lines
2. Open the find-module
3. Enable regex-matching
4. Enter the last character from any line in your file, followed by \n. For example `a\n`.
5. Observe that no lines were found.

However, `.?\n` and `.*\n` works, but only highlights the newline character.

I have identified this error on my Windows 7 machine, but it does not reproduce on my Mac.

data.title: Editor active file is shown in exlorer (how to turn off)
data.body: Every time I change active file in the editor, In explorer file tree it jumps to it. Is it possible to disable this behaviour and make it possible to show it in explorer manually on demand? (I see in my `keybindings.json` there is commented `workbench.files.action.showActiveFileInExplorer`)

data.title: Help Wanted: Proxy testing
data.body:
Hi! If you were pinged to this thread, it's because **VS Code needs your help**!

Users behind proxies have had a tough time lately, and we want to make sure we fix this. We've created a [small app](https://github.com/joaomoreno/proxy-tests) which will test your machine, network and environment to figure out which network stack works best for you.

<details>
<summary>App Screenshot</summary>

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/21641156/58b06908-d27a-11e6-981a-2f4555a3c680.png)

</details>

## How can I help?

We ask you to:

1. [Download](https://github.com/joaomoreno/proxy-tests/releases) and extract the appropriate ZIP for your platform
2. Run it
3. Type your proxy URL in the input box
4. Click `Run Tests`
5. Be patient, it should eventually be done
6. Copy the test results to your clipboard
7. Finally, reply to this thread with:
  - Details about your machine (platform, OS)
  - Details about your network (proxy type, is it a corporate environment)
  - A list of the network-related features that don't work for you in VSCode
  - The results of the test

Example reply:

> I'm running Windows 10, I am in a corporate environment and I know my proxy address. I can browse VS Code extensions but I can't install them.
> 
> [PASTE TABLE]

We thank you in advance!

---

@liaoya, @dfroze, @akcorp2003, @ruslanch, @bruceauyeung, @raphabi, @eric-brunel, @fazouane-marouane, @Msira10, @onybo, @ywmail, @foisonocean, @xuewang, @distums, @NeWbY100, @abargstaedt

data.title: [html] Configure source root in for html documents

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.8.1

My workspace is like this:

```
- root
-     application
-     html
-        css
-        assets
```
In the html, the src is this `<script src="/assets/ztree/jquery.ztree.all.min.js"></script>`. So when I click it with ctrl, VScode cannot jump to the right file.

Is there any way to rewrite the src? Or just add a API in extension?

data.title: Investigate and Improve Key bindings customisations experience
data.body:
Investigate and improve key bindings customisations experience. 

Following are the proposals, use cases, challenges in this area

### Keybindings view
A table based view, each row for each key binding

Key | Command | When | Action
------------ | ------------- | ------------- | -------
alt+cmd+[ | editor.fold | editorTextFocus | Unbind
alt+cmd+] | editor.unfoldRecursively | editorTextFocus | Unbind
Bind | workbench.action.reloadWindow |  | Bind

#### Show the correct Keybindings based on the keyboard layout (both defaults and user)

Currently, keybindings show the keys those were shown in the US Keyboard. Since the keys location changes with Keyboard layout, some of the Keybindings shown as is in the file do not work. For eg: 
<kbd>ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>`</kbd> does not work on German layout key board. Instead the associated Keybinding for this is <kbd>ctrl</kbd>+<kbd><</kbd>

#### Show the invalid Keybindings
Some key bindings might not makes sense in some keyboard layouts since . Show such keybindings as unbound entries, probably with message?

#### Grouping

Group key bindings by VS code core and each extension key bindings

#### Command id vs title

Show just title or just id or both for the command column? Not all commands have labels and not all command ids are straight to interpret what action they perform. Not all command ids maps well with labels.

#### When context

`when`  is a combination of the location in VS Code where key binding is applied to and the pre-condition to be met to trigger the action. Not all commands have proper separation of location and precondition. Also some commands have multiple locations. How to render this when clause? How to let user edit this?

#### Command args

`args` How to display args

#### Bound and unbound commands 

Display bound and unbound commands as two different groups

### As a user, I would like to associate a Keybinding to a command/action

User should be able to find an action say in `Keybindings editor` or `Command Pallette` and associate a key binding to it. Use the widget `Define Keybinding` to record the Key bindings instead of writing it by hand. 

An action next to command pallette list entry to bind/unbind the key binding?

### As a user, I would like to find the command/action for a Keybinding.

User should be able to find the Keybinding in `Keybindings editor` and see the associated commands/actions to it. 

### As a sophisticated user, I would like to switch to native old keybindings json from the new editor
